p: Lignans and isoflavonoids are the major classes of phytoestrogens [ 97] which showed potential anticancer activity against various cells. Three lignans, namely, (−)-carinol ( 50), (−)-carissanol ( 51), and (−)-nortrachelogenin, isolated from Carissa spinarum,were found to be cytotoxic against A549, MCF-7, and WI-38 cell lines. Among these, (−)-carinol (i.e., a compound with butanediol structure) showed more potent cytotoxic activity against these three cell lines with IC 50 value of 1 µg/mL, as compared to (−)-carissanol and (−)-nortrachelogenin [ 98]. Secoisolariciresinol ( 52) and matairesino ( 53), two lignans isolated from Linum usitatissimum, exhibited cytotoxicity against MCF-7 cells with IC 50 values of 10 and 1 µM, respectively [ 99].
